newsitem.title: USA: Richmond Cty, Ga., to vote on $115 mln school GOs.
newsitem.headline: Richmond Cty, Ga., to vote on $115 mln school GOs.

text.p: Georgia's Richmond County scheduled a Nov 5 referendum on $115 million of general obligation bonds for schools, school officials said Wednesday.
School trustees approved the referendum in an 8-2 vote Tuesday. The school bond referendum is the county's first since 1988, when voters approved a $22.5 million issue.
Debt service on the bonds would add $98.80 per year to the property tax bill for a $100,000 home.

But the proposal is structured so that much of the debt service could instead be paid with sales tax revenues if voters also approve a statewide referendum allowing school systems to use sales taxes for construction, school officials said.
